item.title: Test Post
item.description: Welcome! Here are two links to project 1 and google: Link to project 1 Link to google Using R-Studio, we can create different types of graphs used for analysis. Down below we have a histogram we created by using the code "hist". Then we used reticulate to have r and python talk to one another as seen below. hist(quakes$mag) library(reticulate) something <- "Using Reticulate" quakes <- quakes dumb="Is Difficult" print(r.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
